paper_abstract: We show that m points and n two-dimensional algebraic surfaces in can have at most incidences, provided that the algebraic surfaces behave like pseudoflats with k degrees of freedom, and that . As a special case, we obtain a Szemer,di-Trotter type theorem for 2-planes in , provided and the planes intersect transversely. As a further special case, we obtain a Szemer,di-Trotter type theorem for complex lines in with no restrictions on m and n (this theorem was originally proved by Tth using a different method). As a third special case, we obtain a Szemer,di-Trotter type theorem for complex unit circles in . We obtain our results by combining several tools, including a two-level analogue of the discrete polynomial partitioning theorem and the crossing lemma.
paper_title: A Szemeredi-Trotter Type Theorem in R-4
